meanings.definition: The official currency of the European Union.
meanings.sent1: I used euros to buy a souvenir in France.
meanings.sent2: She exchanged dollars for euros at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine only accepted euros, so I couldn't buy a snack.
meanings.sent4: His love for travel was as strong as the euro against the dollar.
meanings.sent5: The shiny euros in his wallet reminded him of his trip to Europe.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency used in many European countries.
meanings.sent1: The price of the book was ten euros.
meanings.sent2: In Italy, you can pay with euros or credit cards.
meanings.sent3: The street performer juggled euros to entertain the crowd.
meanings.sent4: Her savings in euros grew steadily over the years.
meanings.sent5: The sound of coins clinking together signaled the arrival of euros.

meanings.sent1: She had a handful of euros in her purse.
meanings.sent2: They won a bet and received fifty euros as a prize.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat, and it was holding euros!
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with laughter and the rustle of euros changing hands.
meanings.sent5: The colorful euros scattered on the table like confetti at a celebration.
